did.origination: Confederate States of America, Subsistence Department

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Confederate States of America. Subsistence Department. Commissary records, 1861-1865. Accession 31327. Organization records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Purchased from the Buchanan Town Improvement Society, Route 1, Box 243A, Buchanan, Virginia

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Records, 1861-1865, of Thomas T. S. Barton, acting commissary for the Subistence Department of the Confederate States of America, consisting of appointments, circulars, correspondence, financial records, orders, regulations, and other papers concerning Barton's work as commissary for the Confederacy in western Virginia. Records detail Barton's efforts to get supplies in western Virginia for the Confederate army, and provide information concerning daily rations for troops, teamsters, and others involved in the war effort. Also contain information on prices for pork, beef, flour, coffee, soap, and other items as well as the commissary expenditures. Papers also include Barton's personal correspondence.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into the following series:

list.item: I: Orders, Regulations, Circulars, and Appointments.

did.unittitle: Series I: Orders, Circulars, Regulations, and Appointments, 1861-1865.
Monthly Financial Records, January 1865, folder 1 of 2.
Monthly Financial Records, January 1865, folder 2 of 2.
Quarterly Financial Records ending September 1861, folder 1 of 2.
Quarterly Financial Records ending September 1861, folder 2 of 2.
